intro: Thlaspi bursetta, commonly known as the basketweed or winter cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, green, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it thrives in moist, disturbed soils. Thlaspi bursetta has a short flowering period in spring and is often found in gardens and along roadsides. It is known for its ability to tolerate cold temperatures and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
